contextId.information: "something crushes them" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: are crushed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Can you eat that which has no taste" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Can that which has no taste be eaten

contextId.information: "A friend should be faithful to the person who feels who is about to faint" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: To the person who is about to faint, faithfulness should be shown by his friend

contextId.information: This can be expressed in active form. AT: "As a cloud fades" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: As a cloud is consumed

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "no one can rebuild it" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: it cannot be built again

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "to whom alone God gave the land" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to whom alone the land was given

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. The word "rocks" here refers to large rocks, such as those in the mountains. AT: "should God remove the rocks from their places" or "should God move mountains around" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: should the rocks be removed out of their places

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. Also, this speaks of a disease destroying his body as if it were an animal that had attacked him and was eating him. AT: "Disease will eat away at his skin" or "Disease will destroy his skin" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]] and [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]])
contextId.quote: The parts of his body will be devoured

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "Disaster rips him out of his tent, where he is safe" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: He is torn from the safety of his tent

contextId.information: Here dying is spoken of as if God snatched them away. This can be stated in active form. AT: "those who died" or "those whom God took away" (See: [[:en:ta:vol1:translate:figs_metaphor]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who were snatched away

contextId.information: Here "those who rose up" refers to the wicked people. This can be stated in active form. AT: "God has destroyed the wicked people who harmed us" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: those who rose up against us are cut off

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "People take iron out of the earth" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Iron is taken out of the earth

contextId.information: Here "my heart" represents Job. The phrase "has been attracted to" can be stated in active form. AT: "If I have desired another man's wife" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_synecdoche]] and [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If my heart has been attracted to another woman

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "for which judges would be right to punish me" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: to be punished by judges

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God also punishes a person" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Man is punished also

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "but God did not punish me for sinning" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: but my sin was not punished

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "God considers me to be a liar" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: I am considered to be a liar

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "If only we could put Job on trial in" or "If only we could take Job to court so a judge could listen to" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If only Job were put on trial in

contextId.information: Here the word "they" refers righteous people whom God will discipline if they sin. This can be stated in active form. AT: "If someone binds them in chains" or "If someone makes them a prisoner" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: If they are bound in chains

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "when people hear his voice" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when his voice is heard

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. "On what did I set its foundations" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: On what were its foundations laid

contextId.information: This can be stated in active form. AT: "The morning takes away the 'light' of wicked people." (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: From wicked people their 'light' is taken away

contextId.information: The rain makes the loose dry dirt stick together like one piece of dirt. This can be stated in active form. AT: "when the rain molds the dirt into a hard mass" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: when the dust runs into a hard mass

contextId.information: This can be translated in active form. A club made of straw would not hurt him, and a club made of wood would not hurt him. AT: "He thinks of clubs as if they were straw" (See: [[:en:ta:vol2:translate:figs_activepassive]])
contextId.quote: Clubs are regarded as straw
